effect.description: The identifier of the status effect.
effect.markdownDescription: The identifier of the status effect.

duration.description: Determines the duration of the status effect (in ticks).
duration.markdownDescription: Determines the duration of the status effect (in ticks).

amplifier.description: Determines the strength of the status effect (0 being level 1).
amplifier.markdownDescription: Determines the strength of the status effect (0 being level 1).

is_ambient.description: Determines whether the particle effects of the status effect is less noticeable.
is_ambient.markdownDescription: Determines whether the particle effects of the status effect is less noticeable.

show_particles.description: Determines whether the status effect should display particle effects on the entity.
show_particles.markdownDescription: Determines whether the status effect should display particle effects on the entity.

show_icon.description: Determines whether the status effect would display an icon on the HUD.
show_icon.markdownDescription: Determines whether the status effect would display an icon on the HUD.

type.description:
[Data Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/status_effect_instance)

An [Object](object.md) used to define a status effect with duration, amplifier, etc.


!!! note

    To make the Status Effect Instance infinite, you can set the value of `duration` to `-1`.
type.markdownDescription:
[Data Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/status_effect_instance)

An [Object](object.md) used to define a status effect with duration, amplifier, etc.


!!! note

    To make the Status Effect Instance infinite, you can set the value of `duration` to `-1`.
